articles.description: This weekly column by our team of international health editors highlights more of the recently published articles from The Conversation’s global network.
articles.content:
As the world approaches 2.5 million coronavirus cases, some regions have reached the peak of the virus and the number of new cases and deaths is slowing.

articles.author: By Ryan Morrison For Mailonline
articles.title: Wild birds can lower the temperature of their beaks to preserve energy during food shortages - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers at the University of Glasgow used thermal imaging technology to measure the body surface temperature of birds faced with food shortages.
articles.content:
Wild birds can cut the temperature of their beaks when food is scarce to help them preserve energy and prevent heat loss, a study has found. 
Researchers at the University of Glasgow used thermal imaging technology to measure the body surface temperature of … [+4666 chars]

articles.description: In Namibia, the Africa Millimetre Telescope could could unlock secrets about black holes.
articles.content:
